education.field_of_study: International General Certificate of Secondary Education (IGCSE)

awards.title: Mobile Application Launchpad - 3rd Place
awards.description:
The Mobile App Launchpad Competition, powered by the MIT Enterprise Forum Pan Arab, will encourage students who have taken the Google-Sponsored Udacity Course (Developing Android Apps) to apply the know-how they have acquired in developing start-ups with mobile apps.

Our start-up Wasteless Egypt won 3rd place in the Start-up Track, beating 20 other start-ups and securing a prize of 7000USD worth of seed funding.
awards.issuer: Google, MIT Pan Arab Forum and  Ministry of Communications & Information Technology

awards.title: Semifinalist - Enactus World Cup
awards.description:
Once a year, the National Champion Enactus teams from around world meet at the Enactus World Cup where they present the results of their community outreach projects to a prestigious group of international business leaders. The teams are evaluated based on how successful they were at using business concepts to improve the quality of life and standard of living for people in need.

We, as Enactus Cairo University team, representing Egypt, successfully reached the semi final stage, competing with 36 nations present at the Enactus in World Cup held in Johannesburg, South Africa

awards.title: 1st place - Enactus Egypt National Competition
awards.description:
National Competitions are energy-filled events where Enactus Egypt teams showcase the collective impact of their community outreach efforts.

With the aim of sharing and improving the quality of different Enactus projects, students present their projects and are evaluated by business leaders serving as judges who rank them on how successful they were at using business concepts to improve the quality of life and standard of living for those in need and the most impact creating economic opportunities for others. The winners of these national competitions are then invited to compete at the prestigious Enactus World Cup, amongst 39 other countries.

certifications.name: Data Science for Product Managers Bootcamp
Management Tools for Innovation Awareness Creation in SMEs

projects.title: Consulting Project - Newfound
projects.description:
For my final module during undertaking the MSc Innovation, Entrepreneurship & Management program at Imperial College Business School, I was tasked along with four colleagues on the program to undertake a consulting engagement. 

Our client for the project was Newfound , who defined their business as a consultancy that specializes in scaling ambitious tech companies to new markets, with the majority of their client being business-to-business (B2B) companies in the Software as a Service (SaaS) sector. The company’s main clients were companies from Australia and New Zealand looking to scale their products to the United Kingdom. The task for our consulting engagement with Newfound was to:

- Develop a strategy on how Newfound can extend its offerings to technology companies in further markets.
- Conduct research on 5 global hubs suggested by Newfound and recommend 3 new target
markets that Newfound can penetrate based on several assessment criteria
- Develop a promotional strategy for Newfound to penetrate the suggested markets and acquire
potential clients in the SaaS industry.

contributors.headline: Director of Business Development | Startup Mentor & Investor | Ex - Jio, Citi | MSc Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Management

profile_positions.description:
Bloom & Wild is Europe's #1 online flower company, home to the Bloom & Wild, bloomon & Bergamotte brands, trading across 8 countries

Key responsibilities:
- Leading product efforts across the range and logistics domains for the bloomon and Bloom & Wild brands
profile_positions.title: Product Manager

profile_positions.description:
Breadfast delivers household essentials, bakeries, groceries, fruits, veggies, and more than 3,000 items in minutes

Key responsibilities:
 - Collaborated with cross-functional teams to develop & launch the Breadfast Pickers app, the internal mobile app used in order fulfillment. The app targeted decreasing preparation errors, improving data & visibility on the order preparation process, and decreasing overall preparation time
- Launched features across multiple tools as part of the Supply Chain squad targeting decreasing packaging time, improving waste tracking and increasing stock accuracy
- Led product initiatives to enhance first & mid-mile operations, which included enhancements to the internal stock transfers and ERP integrations to support and track internal transfers between warehouses & fulfilment points
profile_positions.title: Product - Last Mile & Supply Chain

profile_positions.description:
Openner.vc is a Pre-Seed and Seed venture capital firm focused on investing in technology based startups globally

Key responsibilities:
- Leading market insights and validation efforts with portfolio companies
- Feeding insights to technology & design teams to drive strategic product decisions
profile_positions.title: Venture Lead

profile_positions.description:
Knowledge Officer is a London-based startup with the mission of organizing the world’s knowledge and adding context to content. We build personalized and dynamic learning paths to help individuals reach their career goals and companies train their workforce.

Key responsibilities:
- Working closely with the founders on launching new products and monetization strategies
- Leading project work across a variety of disciplines: sales, partnerships, marketing, user analysis, product
- Testing new initiatives and tracking their impact on the company's metrics
- Supporting the strategic direction of the business with insight and analysis
profile_positions.title: Entrepreneur In Residence

profile_positions.description:
Imperial College London is consistently ranked among the top 10 universities in the world. The Business School is one of the top one percent of business schools worldwide with accreditation from The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB), Association of MBAs (AMBA) & European Quality Improvement System (EQUIS)

MSc Innovation, Entrepreneurship & Management is an intensive one-year, full-time programme which prepares graduates for a wide spectrum of career opportunities such as launching a new business, developing business start-ups and consulting on innovation.
profile_positions.title: MSc Innovation, Entrepreneurship & Management - Candidate

profile_positions.description:
For my final module during undertaking the MSc Innovation, Entrepreneurship & Management program at Imperial College Business School, I was tasked along with four colleagues on the program to undertake a consulting engagement.

Our client for the project was Newfound, who defined their business as a consultancy that specializes in scaling ambitious tech companies to new markets, with the majority of their client being business-to-business (B2B) companies in the Software as a Service (SaaS) sector. The company’s main clients were companies from Australia and New Zealand looking to scale their products to the United Kingdom. The task for our consulting engagement with Newfound was to:

- Conduct research on 5 global hubs suggested by Newfound and recommend 3 new target
markets that Newfound can penetrate based on several assessment criteria

profile_positions.title: Consultant (MSc Placement)

profile_positions.description:
Rainmaking is a corporate innovation and venture development firm, creating, accelerating, and scaling new businesses with the world’s leading corporations and entrepreneurs. 

Key responsibilities:
- Researching different industries to identify key trends and promising technology startups.
- Scouting and recruiting startups for different accelerator programs globally and different engagements with multinational corporate clients.
- Building a local pipeline for Rainmaking's StartupBootCamp fintech accelerator in Cairo.
profile_positions.title: Startup Scout

profile_positions.description:
Averroes Ventures is a Venture Capital firm which invests in tech-enabled early stage startups in the MENA region and internationally. I undertook the role on a full-time basis till September 2018, then shifted to part-time.

Key responsibilities:
- Sourcing deals and identifying investment trends and opportunities
- Screening and initial selection of pipeline startups
- Executing deals and due diligence process with pipeline startups
- Writing and producing PPM documents and presentation materials for raising capital
- Supporting portfolio startups with industry connections and helping with their growth & business development
profile_positions.title: Venture Capital Associate

profile_positions.description:
Innoventures, LLC was founded in 2011, as an innovation platform to bring the wealth of original Egyptian technology ideas to market. These ideas are potentially successful business ventures, with an innovative team behind them, but are missing the correct management and supporting business facilities, such as financing, marketing, etc. Innoventures adopts these project ideas, explores them further, and manages them until they are profitable, high-impact, growing businesses. 

Key responsibilities:
- Building a community of entrepreneurs, investors and industry experts.
- Managing, planning and coordinating programs with our clients and partners.
- Managing the process of selection and investment and monitoring of start-up ventures.
- Working with our management team on developing company strategy.
- Proposing and leading new initiatives to build our brand, grow our business, and contribute to the startup community.
- Writing proposals, plans, project reports, communications and marketing materials.
profile_positions.title: Accelerator Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
Wasteless Egypt is a social enterprise that aims to promote responsible consumption and environmental awareness. Our first project is a platform that helps individual consumers and organizations in donating and distributing unused products and commodities to non-profits and recycling businesses that can re-use or recycle these products in an environmentally sustainable manner. This takes place through an location-based, easy-to-use mobile application making it easy and convenient for both donors and receiving organizations.

- Wasteless Egypt won 3rd Place and seed funding in the Mobile Application Launchpad Startup Competition by Google & MIT Pan Arab Forum
- Secured partnerships with leading non-profits including the Egyptian Food Bank
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

volunteer_experiences.description: VC Talks was founded in 2018 at Imperial College with a simple goal – to help students develop an understanding of trends in Venture Capital and guide them on the skills essential to be a success as future Venture Capitalists or Founders. At VC Talks, we aim to deliver a breadth of educational and collaborative events focusing solely on VC.

Wasteless Egypt is a social enterprise that aims to promote responsible consumption and environmental awareness. Our first project is a platform that helps individual consumers and organizations in donating and distributing unused products and commodities to non-profits and recycling businesses that can re-use or recycle these products in an environmentally sustainable manner. This takes place through an location-based, easy-to-use mobile application making it easy and convenient for both donors and receiving organizations.

• Wasteless Egypt won 3rd Place and seed funding in the Mobile Application Launchpad Startup Competition by Google & MIT Pan Arab Forum.

volunteer_experiences.role: Alumni Advisory Board Member - Enactus Cairo
volunteer_experiences.description:
The Alumni Advisory Board actively helps and mentors the Enacus Cairo team throughout the year in the development and implementation of their community development projects through sharing expertise and building the capacity of the organization's members and leadership body.

• Participated in ideation and strategy setting sessions for different Enactus projects.
• Led fundraising and business development training sessions.
• Mentored team leaders and advised on marketing and business development strategies.

Growing Grassroots is a German-Egyptian environmental exchange program organized by BUNDjugend Berlin, Icealexandria, the Arab Youth Climate Movement and funded by the German Foreign Office. The program addresses issues related to climate change, environmental sustainability, urban development and offers the participants with opportunities to meet in both Berlin and Cairo, share knowledge, experiences and excitement about environmental issues as well as meet with environmental activists, non-profits and social enterprises in both countries.

Responsibilities:

• Responsible for the entire organization process of the program including recruiting exchange participants, scheduling program, contacting speakers, facilitating sessions, workshops, logistics, final impact measurement and reporting to the German Ministry for Foreign Affairs.
• Participated in the program in 2015, volunteered to organize and coordinate the program in 2016 and 2017.

volunteer_experiences.role: Vice President for Marketing & External Relations - Enactus Cairo
volunteer_experiences.description:
Enactus is an international non-profit organization that brings together students, academic and business leaders who are committed to using the power of entrepreneurial action to improve the quality of life and standard of living for people in need.

Key responsibilities & achievements:

• Led the team to its best performance in 4 years, winning Enactus Egypt's National Competition and representing Egypt in Enactus World Cup International Competition.
• Planned and executed all marketing campaigns for the organization's projects, products and events.
• Trained 40+ members of the External Relations Directorate on marketing and fundraising.
• Introduced a new structure and added a new team to the organization, the Corporate Relations team.
• Worked with the leadership body to formulate and enhance CRM strategy and CSR approach.
• Provided the organization with exposure and secured several media appearances.
• Secured sponsorship deals and key partnerships.

TED (Technology, Entertainment, Design) is a global set of conferences run by the private non-profit Sapling Foundation, under the slogan "Ideas Worth Spreading". The TEDx Program is designed to help communities, organizations and individuals to spark conversation and connection through local TED-like experiences.

Key responsibilities & achievements:

• Organizing the 1st ever TEDx conference in Cairo University.
• Recruiting, interviewing and selecting speakers according to the TEDx criteria.
• Coaching and training speakers during their preparations on presentation skills and public speaking.
• Supervising and finalizing scripts of the talks of the speakers prior to their performances.

volunteer_experiences.role: Outgoing Community Development Program Executive - AIESEC Cairo University
volunteer_experiences.description:
AIESEC is an international non-governmental not-for-profit organization that provides young people with leadership development and cross-cultural global internship and volunteer exchange experiences across the globe, with a focus to empower young people so they can make a positive impact on society. The AIESEC network includes over 100,000 members in 126 countries and territories. It is the largest youth-run organization in the world.

Key responsibilities:

• Led marketing campaigns on and off campus raising awareness about global citizenship and attracting volunteers for international exchange opportunities
• Recruiting, interviewing, selecting and matching applicants for international exchange opportunities and community development projects.
• Tracking and monitoring of the volunteers’ progress in their host countries.

The Model of American Congress (MAC) is a student society based in the Faculty of Economics and Political science, Cairo University. The model simulates the legislative process of the American Congress through engaging participants in debates in which they represent real senators, tackling important issues in the U.S., and producing bills (legislation) and resolutions. The participants receive academic content, get introduced to American politics, engage in team projects and work on their soft skills.

Key responsibilities and achievements:

• Recruiting, interviewing and selecting the participants.
• Giving over 30 presentations covering topics on U.S. history, American politics and miscellaneous soft skills.
• Writing and editing the Background paper (BGP), a handbook including detailed academic research on the academic topics discussed in the committee.
• Facilitating workshops, team projects throughout the sessions and a 5-day simulation process during the final conference
